newsitem.title: USA: Union Texas reports two Pakistan oil finds.
newsitem.headline: Union Texas reports two Pakistan oil finds.

text.p: Union Texas Petroleum Holdings on Monday reported two oil finds in the Sindh province in southeastern Pakistan.
The two exploration wells flowed at rates just over 3,000 barrels per day (bpd) and 2,100 bpd, the company said.

The Jagir No.1 exploration well flowed at a daily rate of 3,027 barrels of oil per day on a 48/64-inch choke with 410 pounds-per-square-inch flowing tubing pressure from the Lower Goru formation between 7,060 and 7,226 feet.

The Sakhi No.1 exploration well tested at a daily rate of 2,106 barrels of oil per day on a 32/64-inch choke with 1,032 pounds-per-square-inch flowing tubing pressure from the Lower Goru formation between 6,596 and 6,646 feet.
The Sakhi well was placed on production on August 14, producing an average of 800 barrels of oil per day.
Both wells are located approximately 125 miles (200 kilometers) northeast of Karachi.
